intro: Bulbocodium flaveolum, commonly known as the yellow bulbous bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer, typically from June to August. Its bulbous root system allows it to store water and nutrients, aiding survival in dry conditions. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
